name: Tomorrow
description: '''Tomorrow''' (previously known as '''The In Crowd''' and '''Four Plus One''') were an English musical group active in the 1960s, whose music touched on [[psychedelic rock]], [[psychedelic pop|pop]] and [[freakbeat]]. Despite critical acclaim and support from [[disc jockey|DJ]] [[John Peel]], who featured them on his "[[The Perfumed Garden (radio show)|Perfumed Garden]]" radio show, the band never achieved great commercial success. They were among the first psychedelic bands in England, along with [[Pink Floyd]] and [[Soft Machine]]. Tomorrow recorded the first John Peel show session on [[BBC Radio 1]] on 21 September 1967. The band included [[Keith West]] of "[[Excerpt from A Teenage Opera]]" fame on vocals and [[Steve Howe (guitarist)|Steve Howe]] on guitars, who would later join the British [[progressive rock]] band [[Yes (band)|Yes]].
